channel.title: Cheats on Cheats and Recipes
channel.description: Recent content in Cheats on Cheats and Recipes

item.title: iTerm2 Cheatsheet
item.description: iTerm2 is a terminal emulator for macOS that does amazing things.

item.title: Functional JavaScript Cheatsheet
item.description: Functional programming is writing functions and expressions that are free from any side-effects, including mutating variables.

item.title: Bash Cheatsheet
item.description: Bash is a popular command line shell found in Unix and MacOS operating systems.

item.title: Cron Cheatsheet
item.description: A time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems.

item.title: CSS Flexbox Cheatsheet
item.description: Use CSS Flexbox to control the layout of HTML elements in a single dimension (horizontal or vertical).

item.title: CSS Grid Cheatsheet
item.description: Use CSS Grid to control the layout of HTML elements in 2 dimensions (horizontal and vertical).

item.title: Docker Cheatsheet
item.description: Cheat sheet for Docker CLI Commands

item.title: ES2015+ Cheatsheet
item.description: A quick overview of new JavaScript features in ES2015, ES2016, ES2017, ES2018 and beyond.

item.title: Go Cheatsheet
item.description: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

item.title: Homebrew Cheatsheet
item.description: The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux).

item.title: Hugo Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent Go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website. If you have used other template systems from different languages or frameworks you will find a lot of similarities in Go templates.

item.title: JavaScript Date Cheatsheet
item.description: The JavaScript Date constructor function and methods of Date objects.

item.title: JavaScript Modern Array Methods Cheatsheet
item.description: Array methods are a powerful way to iterate over an array to create a new Array or value.

item.title: JavaScript Promises Cheatsheet
item.description: A promise represents the eventual result of an asynchronous operation. JavaScript promises were added to the language in ES-2015.

item.title: JSDoc Cheatsheet
item.description: JSDoc 3 is an API documentation generator for JavaScript, similar to Javadoc or phpDocumentor. You add documentation comments directly to your source code, right alongside the code itself. The JSDoc tool will scan your source code and generate an HTML documentation website for you.

item.title: Knex Cheatsheet
item.description: Knex is an SQL query builder for Node.js. This guide targets v0.13.0.

item.title: npm vs yarn Cheatsheet
item.description: Compares npm and yarn commands. Taken from Infinite Red’s NPM vs YARN Cheatsheet.

item.title: Pivotal Cloud Foundry Cheatsheet
item.description: PCF is an application PaaS (Platform as a Service) cloud platform.

item.title: Pivotal Concourse Cheatsheet
item.description: Pivotal Concourse is a CI/CD tool.

item.title: PostgreSQL Cheatsheet
item.description: PostgreSQL is a relational database.

item.title: React Cheatsheet
item.description: React.js is a declarative, component based JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

item.title: React Router Cheatsheet
item.description: React Router is a dynamic, distributed router for React.js.

item.title: RegEx Cheatsheet
item.description: Regular Expressions are a powerful way to do pattern matching on strings.

item.title: SemVer Cheatsheet
item.description: Semver, short for “semantic versioning” is a versioning system that encodes the impact of changes between releases on the public interface directly into the version string.
